source_sentence: 爾時世尊即為聚落主，隨順說法示教利喜，如染淨[疊*毛]易為受色，即於坐上見四聖諦。

translation: The Buddha said, "It's a good idea to know this then."

source_sentence: 起禮佛足右遶而去。
translation: He got up, bowed his head at the Buddha's feet, circled to his right, and departed.

source_sentence: 去不久佛往眾多比丘所，敷尼師檀坐已，語諸比丘：「向周羅聚落主來到我所，如上廣說，乃至右遶而去。」
translation: Soon after he left, the Buddha went to a large group of monks, spread out his sitting mat, and said to the monks, "When the chief of the Cūḍḍapanthaka community comes to me, he explains it as detailed above, and then he goes around to the right."

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「汝等當如是學，不得畜金銀，我無有方便得畜金銀。」
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "You must thus train yourselves not to store gold or silver, for there's no way for me to store gold or silver."

source_sentence: 復次佛住舍衛城，廣說如上。
translation: Again, the Buddha stayed in Śrāvastī and explained it in detail as above.

source_sentence: 世尊以五事利益故，五日一行諸比丘房，見難陀、優波難陀住處。
translation: For five days, the Bhagavān went to the monks' quarters and saw Nandana and Upananda staying there because of five benefits.

source_sentence: 時難陀、優波難陀數錢，手上著土，往詣世尊頭面禮足却住一面，佛知而故問：「手上何以著土？」
translation: When Nandha and Upananda were counting their money and had dirt on their hands, they went to the Bhagavān, bowed their heads at their feet, and withdrew to one side, and the Buddha knew and asked, "Why is there dirt on your hands?"

source_sentence: 答言：「世尊！
translation: They replied, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我數錢故手上有土。」
translation: I count money so I have dirt on my hands."

source_sentence: 佛語難陀：「汝等云何手自捉生色、似色，從今日不聽手自持生色、似色。」
translation: The Buddha said to Nandana, "How do you grasp the living form and resembling form in your own hands, and from now on you won't hear of the living form and resembling form being held in your own hands?"

source_sentence: 復次佛住毘舍離大林重閣精舍，廣說如上。
translation: Again, the Buddha stayed at Vaiśālī's large, wooded, double-storied monastery and explained it in detail as above.

source_sentence: 時優陀夷時到著入聚落衣持鉢，至一泥師家，其家始作節會訖。
translation: Udayinī then arrived, put on his robe and bowl, and went to the house of a nun who had just finished performing a festival.

source_sentence: 其婦出迎作禮問言：「尊者！
translation: The woman greeted him and saluted him, saying, "Venerable!

source_sentence: 昨日何以不來？
translation: Why didn't you come yesterday?

source_sentence: 若來者當得好飲食。」
translation: If you come, you'll get a good meal."

source_sentence: 答言：「昨日、今日復何在耶？
translation: He replied, "Where were they yesterday and today?

source_sentence: 若有好食便可持來。」
translation: If there's any good food, you can bring it here."

source_sentence: 白言：「好食已盡，今與尊者錢，可於店上易好食。」
translation: He said, "I've finished the good food, so now I'll give the venerable money to buy some good food at the store."

source_sentence: 答言：「世尊制戒，不聽我自手捉錢。
translation: He replied, "The Bhagavān established the precept that I shouldn't be allowed to grab money with my own hands.

source_sentence: 汝可以錢繫我衣角。」
translation: You may tie the money to the corner of my robe."

source_sentence: 即如其言繫錢而去。
translation: He then tied the money as he had said and departed.

source_sentence: 至市肆上語言：「長壽！
translation: He went up to the marketplace and said, "Long life!

source_sentence: 與我餅來。」
translation: Come with me by biscuit."

source_sentence: 答言：「尊者！
translation: They replied, "Venerable!

source_sentence: 示我錢來。」
translation: Show me the money."

source_sentence: 優陀夷言：「但與我餅，我不動此處，當與汝錢。」
translation: Udāyin said, "Just give me bread; I won't touch this place, and I'll give you money."

source_sentence: 白言：「尊者！
translation: He said, "Venerable!

source_sentence: 持鉢來。」
translation: Bring me my bowl."

source_sentence: 即與鉢盛滿種種餅食，與已語言：「與我錢來。」
translation: He then gave them a bowl full of various cakes and foods and said, "Give me money."

source_sentence: 答言：「汝自衣角頭解取。」
translation: He replied, "Take it from the horn of your robe and untie it."

source_sentence: 肆上人欲調弄故不與解，語言：「汝自解與我。」
translation: The unscrupulous man who wanted to play with it didn't give it to him, saying, "Give me your own handwriting."

source_sentence: 答言：「佛不聽我捉生色、似色，汝自解取。」
translation: He replied, "The Buddha doesn't listen to me when I grasp raw form or resembling form, so take it from yourself."

source_sentence: 解取已即呵責言：「云何沙門釋子，以少方便謂此為淨，我等亦不常以手捉及著口中，我亦不繫衣角頭及囊器中。
translation: After understanding and grasping them, he then rebuked them, saying, "Why do ascetics and Śākyamunis say this is pure with little skill, and we don't always grasp them with our hands and put them in our mouths, nor do we tie the corners of our robes and tuck them into our bags and vessels.

source_sentence: 此失沙門法，何道之有？」
translation: This is a violation of the ascetic's teaching, so what path is there?"

source_sentence: 時優陀夷持餅到自房中，喚餘比丘共食，諸比丘即問：「此餅甚好為何處得？
translation: When Udayinī brought some bread into his room and called the other monks to eat it together, the monks asked, "Where did you get this delicious cake?

source_sentence: 此非家中作餅。」
translation: This is not bread made at home."

source_sentence: 答言：「諸長老！
translation: They replied, "Elders!

source_sentence: 此中少利多過。」
translation: Here, there's little benefit and much error."

source_sentence: 諸比丘問言：「何故多過？」
translation: The monks asked, "What's the reason it's so much?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我如是如是因緣是故多過。」
translation: He replied, "I've made many mistakes based on such and such a cause."

source_sentence: 諸比丘以是事具白世尊，佛言：「呼優陀夷來。」
translation: The monks reported all these things to the Bhagavān, and the Buddha said, "Summon Udāyin to come."

source_sentence: 來已，佛問優陀夷：「汝實爾不？」
translation: When he arrived, the Buddha asked Udayinī, "Is that true?"

source_sentence: 答言：「實爾。
translation: They replied, "That's true.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 佛言：「此是惡事，從今日後衣繫亦不聽。」
translation: The Buddha said, "This is a bad deed; from this day forward, I won't listen to it even when my robe is tied."

source_sentence: 復次佛住迦維羅衛城，廣說如上。
translation: Again, the Buddha stayed in the city of Kapilavastu and explained it in detail as above.

source_sentence: 世尊以五事利益故，五日一行諸比丘房，見一比丘痿黃羸瘦，佛知而故問：「比丘忍苦不安隱住不？」
translation: Five days later, the Bhagavān went into the monks' quarters for the benefit of five things and saw a monk who was yellow and thin.

source_sentence: 答言：「世尊！
translation: They replied, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我不安隱，疾病苦惱。」
translation: I'm restless and afflicted by illness."

source_sentence: 佛語比丘：「汝不能索隨病食、隨病藥耶？」
translation: The Buddha said to the monk, "Can't you ask for food and medicine to accompany your illness?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我聞世尊制戒，不得自手捉生色、似色，復無人與我，是故受苦惱。」
translation: He replied, "I've heard that the Bhagavān has established the precept that you can't catch raw form or resembling form with your own hands and that no one can give it to me; that's why I'm suffering."

source_sentence: 佛言：「從今日後，聽病人得使淨人畜，莫貪著。」
translation: The Buddha said, "From now on, listen to the patient and don't get attached to making pure human animals."

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「依止迦維羅衛城比丘皆悉令集，以十利故與諸比丘制戒，乃至已聞者當重聞。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, "Assemble all the monks in the city of Kapilavastu, and give them the precepts for the sake of the ten benefits, even if you've already heard them, you'll hear them again.

source_sentence: 若比丘自手捉生色、似色，若使人捉舉，貪著者，尼薩耆波夜提。」
translation: If a monk grasps raw form or resembling form with his own hands, or if he causes someone to grasp it and become attached to it, that's rules for rules of conduct for monks in Nisajṃpati."

source_sentence: 比丘者，如上說。
translation: A monk, as explained above.

source_sentence: 自手者，若身、若身分、若身相續。
translation: 'Self-handedness' means something like the body, identity, or continuity of the body.

source_sentence: 身者，一切身。
translation: 'Body' is the whole body.

source_sentence: 身分者，若手、若脚、若肘、若膝。
translation: The body parts are the hands, feet, elbows, and knees.

source_sentence: 身相續者，若繫僧伽梨、欝多羅僧、安陀會、覆瘡衣、僧祇枝、雨浴衣、若鉢、小鉢、鍵[金*咨]、銅盂中，如是比是名身相續。
translation: Continuity of body: If it's tied up in a monk's bowl, a uttarâsaṅga, an undergarment, a sores-covering robe, a saṃgha branch, a rain-bathing robe, a bowl, a small bowl, a gong [gold*coat], or a copper bowl, such-and-such is called continuity of body.

source_sentence: 生色者，是金也。
translation: Whatever takes form, it's gold.

source_sentence: 似色者，是銀。
translation: That which resembles form is silver.

source_sentence: 生色似色者，錢等市用物。
translation: That which has form and resembles form is marketable goods like money.

source_sentence: 捉者，若自捉、若語人捉。
translation: He catches it if he catches it himself or if he tells someone to catch it.

source_sentence: 舉者，若自舉、若教人舉。
translation: He lifts it up, whether by himself or by teaching others to lift it up.

source_sentence: 貪著者，作是念：「我當用此物得五欲，謂色、聲、香、味、觸等。」
translation: An addict thinks, "I'll use this thing to get the five desires, which are form, sound, odor, taste, and touch."

source_sentence: 是名貪著。
translation: This is called clinging to desire.

source_sentence: 不貪著者，如清淨持戒比丘，自擔糧食、麨糒、米麪等時，作是念：「我無有方便欲食此食，但於此不淨物中生清淨物想，我當受用。」
translation: Someone who doesn't cling to it is like a monk who follows the precepts of purity and bears his own provisions, such as food, butter, and rice and flour, and thinks, "I don't have the skillful means to want to eat this food, but I will give rise to the idea of this pure thing among the impure things, and I will enjoy it."

source_sentence: 尼薩耆波夜提。
translation: Nisargipānti.

source_sentence: 尼薩耆波夜提者，是金銀錢應僧中捨，波夜提罪應悔過。
translation: Nisargis pāyatti means gold and silver coins should be given up among the saṃgha, and the offense of pāyatti should be repented of.

source_sentence: 若不捨而悔，得越比尼罪。
translation: If someone doesn't abandon it and repent, they'll transgress the vinaya's crimes.

source_sentence: 此金銀、若錢，若作、不作、若多、若少、若純、若雜、若成器、不成器等，僧中捨已不得還，彼比丘僧亦不得分。
translation: Whether made or unmade, large or small, pure or mixed, or whether it forms or doesn't form a vessel, this gold and silver or money cannot be returned after being dispossessed in the saṃgha, nor can it be shared by that monk or nun.

source_sentence: 若多者應著無盡物中。
translation: If it's abundant, it should be placed in an inexhaustible amount of things.

source_sentence: 於此無盡物中，若生息利得作房舍中衣，不得食用。
translation: Of these inexhaustible possessions, if it produces habituated gains for clothing for the monk's dwelling, he mustn't eat it.

source_sentence: 比丘凡得錢及安居訖，得衣直時不得自手取，當使淨人知。
translation: Whenever a monk receives money, receives a donation for his retreat, or receives clothing that's straightforward, he must not take it with his own hands but let a clean person know.

source_sentence: 若無淨人，指示脚邊地語言：「是中知。」
translation: If there's no clean person, he'll show them the ground by their feet and say, "This is the middle way to know."

source_sentence: 著地已，自得用草葉塼瓦等物遙擲覆上，待淨人來令知。
translation: After he touches the ground, he can toss something like grass, leaves, tiles, or other objects over it until a clean person comes along and knows it.

source_sentence: 若淨人來，知已持去；若不可信者，教使在前行，使知置一處；若可信淨人者，從意使知置一處。
translation: If a purified person comes and knows it, he takes it away; if he doesn't trust them, he teaches them to walk in front of him and makes them know to put it in one place; if he trusts a purified person, he makes them know to put it in one place according to his intention.

source_sentence: 若比丘知佛事僧事，多有金銀錢當舉時，若是生地教淨人使知，若是覆處死土、若自掘，若使年少比丘掘。
translation: If a monk knows that the Buddha's business and the saṃgha's business are full of gold and silver coins, he'll teach the purifier to know if it's a living place, or if it's a place covered with dead soil, or if he digs it himself, or if he asks a young monk to dig it.

source_sentence: 若淨人不可信者，裹眼三旋，然後使知地。
translation: If the pure person doesn't believe it, he wraps his eyes three times around it and then makes them know the ground.

source_sentence: 知地已，使知內錢坑中，猶復裹眼使去。
translation: After he knows the ground, he makes himself known to the monk inside the money pit, and then he wraps his eyes again and makes him leave.

source_sentence: 若錢墮坑岸上者，得捉塼瓦擲錢使入坑中，得自填坑。
translation: If the money falls onto the shore of the pit, he can grab a tile and toss it into the pit, and it will fill the pit by itself.

source_sentence: 後欲取時，若是生地使淨人知，若是死地得自掘，抒土到錢。
translation: When he later wants to retrieve it, he'll let a pure person know if it's a living ground or dig himself out if it's a dead ground, and he'll lend the dirt to the money.

source_sentence: 淨人不可信者，復裹眼三旋將來取之。
translation: If the pure person doesn't believe it, he wraps his eyes three times and takes it from there.

source_sentence: 若幞裹中有金銀錢，在橛上不得自捉，當使淨人知。
translation: If there's gold or silver money wrapped up in a turban that can't be grasped by itself on a peg, he'll let a pure person know.

source_sentence: 若淨人小不及者，得抱舉使知取。
translation: If the pure person is too small to grasp it, he can embrace it and lift it up so that he'll know to take it.

source_sentence: 抱時應作是言：「我舉淨人！
translation: When they carry it, they should say, "I'll lift the pure man!

source_sentence: 我舉淨人！」
translation: I lift up pure people!"

source_sentence: 得下物已，當使解。
translation: "After you obtain the following object, you'll make it understand.

source_sentence: 若不知解者，得捉淨人手教使解，解已教知數。
translation: If someone doesn't know how to understand, they can grasp a clean hand and teach it to understand, and after understanding it, they'll be taught to know how to count it.

source_sentence: 若不知數者，得捉淨人手數。
translation: If someone doesn't know how to count it, they can grasp a clean hand and count it.

source_sentence: 數已餘者，還教著囊中。
translation: Whatever is left after counting, he'll teach them to put it back in his bag.

source_sentence: 若不知著囊中者，得捉淨人手教著囊中。
translation: If someone doesn't know how to put it in their bag, they can grab a clean person's hand and teach them to put it in their bag.

source_sentence: 著囊中已，教淨人繫。
translation: After putting it in your bag, you'll be taught to bind it with pure hands.

source_sentence: 若不知繫者，使淨人手捉囊底，比丘得自繫。
translation: If he doesn't know how to bind it, he makes the pure man grab the bottom of the bag with his hand, and the monk is able to bind it himself.

source_sentence: 繫已還置橛上，若淨人短不及者，得抱舉。
translation: After tying it, he puts it back on the peg, and if the pure person is too short to reach it, he can carry it.

source_sentence: 若檻匱箱篋等在架上橛上，取時舉時覆時亦復如上。
translation: If a threshing case or box is placed on a shelf or peg, it's the same when it's picked up and held up, or when it's covered, as above.

source_sentence: 若行道時淨人檐金銀，淨人若小得手牽去，若渡水時得抱渡，應作是言：「我渡淨人！
translation: If a pure person eaves gold or silver while walking on the path, and if the pure person is small enough to carry it by hand, or if he's crossing water, he can carry it across, he should say, "I'll carry the pure person across!

source_sentence: 我渡淨人！」
translation: I will save the Pure Ones!"

source_sentence: 若比丘將淨人行，若淨人小不能上船，得抱上。
translation: "If a monk takes a pure person on a journey, and if he's too small to get into the boat, he can carry him on board.

source_sentence: 應作是言：「我舉淨人！
translation: He should say, "I'll carry the pure person!

source_sentence: 我舉淨人！」
translation: I lift up pure people!"

source_sentence: 下船時亦如是。
translation: "So it is when he disembarks from the boat.

source_sentence: 是比丘若道行食息時，若河、若井、若池上食。
translation: Suppose this monk walks along the path and eats from a river, a well, or a pond.

source_sentence: 食已淨人忘囊去，有長老比丘，在後看諸人不忘物耶？

source_sentence: 有客比丘來，舊比丘有第七日石蜜，語客比丘言：「欲飲石蜜漿不？」
translation: A visiting monk came along, and the old monk, who had the seventh-day heap of rock honey, said to the visiting monk, "Would you like to drink rock honey syrup?"

source_sentence: 答言：「欲飲。」
translation: He replied, "I want to drink it."

source_sentence: 此客比丘即日受石蜜，不作淨而取，是名舊比丘利污客比丘利。
translation: That guest monk who accepted the rock honey that very day and took it without making it pure is called an old monk's benefit that defiles a guest monk's benefit.

source_sentence: 云何客比丘利污客比丘利？
translation: How does a guest monk profit and defile a guest monk's profit?

source_sentence: 有二客比丘眾來，一眾中有第七日石蜜，客比丘語第二眾比丘言：「欲飲石蜜漿不？」
translation: When two groups of guest monks came, and one group had the seventh day's nectar, the guest monk said to the second group of monks, "Would you like to drink the nectar?"

source_sentence: 答言：「欲飲。」
translation: They replied, "I want to drink it."

source_sentence: 此一眾客比丘即日得石蜜，不作淨而受，是名客比丘利污客比丘利。
translation: This group of guest monks who obtained rock honey that very day and accepted it without making it pure is called a guest monk's benefit that defiles a guest monk's benefit.

source_sentence: 云何舊比丘利污舊比丘利？
translation: How do the benefits of former monks defile the benefits of former monks?

source_sentence: 舊比丘有第七日石蜜，語一舊比丘言：「欲飲石蜜漿不？」
translation: An old monk who had the seventh day of rock honey said to an old monk, "Would you like to drink rock honey syrup?"

source_sentence: 答言：「欲飲。」
translation: He replied, "I want to drink it."

source_sentence: 此舊比丘即日受石蜜，不作淨而受，是名舊比丘利污舊比丘利。
translation: This old monk received rock honey that very day and didn't make it pure, which is called an old monk profiting and defiling the old monk's profits.

source_sentence: 云何僧利污比丘利，僧有第七日石蜜，分作分，是比丘即日得石蜜，不作淨而受，是名僧利污比丘利。
translation: What's the benefit of the saṃgha that defiles the monk's benefit? The saṃgha has a seventh day's worth of rock honey, and it's divided into parts; this monk receives rock honey that very day and doesn't make it pure, which is called the benefit of the saṃgha that defiles the monk's benefit.

source_sentence: 云何比丘利污僧利？
translation: How does a monk's benefit defile the monk's benefit?

source_sentence: 比丘有第七日石蜜，即持施僧，僧即日得石蜜，不作淨而取，是名比丘利污僧利。
translation: When a monk has seventh-day rock honey, he gives it to the saṃgha, and the saṃgha gets it the same day and takes it without purifying it, which is called a monk profiting the saṃgha and defiling the saṃgha's profits.

source_sentence: 云何僧利污僧利？
translation: How does it profit the saṃgha and defile the saṃgha's profits?

source_sentence: 僧有第七日石蜜，持與彼僧，彼僧即日得石蜜，不作淨而受者，是名僧利污僧利。
translation: If a monk has seventh-day rock honey, gives it to another monk, and that monk obtains rock honey that same day and accepts it without making it pure, this is called a monk's benefit that defiles the monk's benefit.

source_sentence: 云何比丘利污比丘利？
translation: How does a monk's benefit defile a monk's benefit?

source_sentence: 比丘有第七日石蜜，語比丘言：「汝欲飲石蜜漿不？」
translation: A monk who had the seventh day of rock honey said to a monk, "Do you want to drink rock honey syrup?"

source_sentence: 答言：「須是。」
translation: He replied, "So it shall be."

source_sentence: 比丘即日得石蜜，不作淨而受者，是名比丘利污比丘利。
translation: A monk who obtains rock honey that very day and accepts it without making it pure is called a monk who benefits and defiles monks.

source_sentence: 云何有食間非受間？
translation: How is there a space between eating and not receiving?

source_sentence: 若比丘七日噉石蜜，而并受八日復食者，以不作間得越毘尼罪，當作一日間，是名食間非受間。
translation: If a monk devours rock honey for seven days and receives it again for eight days, he transgresses the vinaya because he didn't do it, and he's considered to be doing it for one day, which is called between eating and not between receiving.

source_sentence: 云何受間非食間？
translation: What is the interval of sensation and the interval of eating?

source_sentence: 若比丘受石蜜，七日不食，八日更受石蜜，無間受，得越毘尼罪。
translation: If a monk takes rock honey and doesn't eat for seven days and takes rock honey again for eight days without interruption, he'll be guilty of transgressing the vinaya.

source_sentence: 當作一日間，是名受間非食間。
translation: He should take a day off, which is called taking a day off and not eating a day off.

source_sentence: 云何受間食間？
translation: What is inter-acquisition and inter-eating?

source_sentence: 若比丘七日受石蜜食已，八日更受更食，得二越比尼罪。
translation: If a monk takes a meal of rock honey for seven days and then takes another meal for eight days, he'll be guilty of two violations of the vinaya.

source_sentence: 云何非受間非食間？
translation: What is the difference between receiving and eating?

source_sentence: 若比丘多誦經胸痛吐血，藥師言：「此病當長服石蜜。」
translation: If a monk who frequently chants sūtras has chest pains and spits up blood, the Bhaiṣajya-guru says, "This illness will require a long period of taking rock honey."

source_sentence: 食前得食石蜜，食後水淨已得食，是名非受間非食間。
translation: Getting to eat rock honey before eating and getting to eat after eating when the water is purified is called not between feeling and not between eating.

source_sentence: 云何石蜜瓶如武羅國？
translation: What is the rock-honey vial like in the country of Vūra?

source_sentence: 欲受具足人，在戒場上受具足已，布施僧石蜜各一瓶。
translation: Those who want to be fully ordained should give the monks a vial of rock honey each after they've been fully ordained on the grounds of ordination.

source_sentence: 諸比丘信心喜作功德，即持石蜜瓶施僧上座。
translation: The monks rejoiced in their faith and merit, so they took the vials of rock honey and gave them to the saṃgha's superior seat.

source_sentence: 上座有信心言：「僧者是良福田。」
translation: The superior monk had faith and said, "The saṃgha is a good field of merit."

source_sentence: 即復施僧。
translation: He then gave it to the saṃgha again.

source_sentence: 諸比丘有第七日石蜜，即取此石蜜，是名相污。
translation: When monks have seventh-day rock honey, they take this rock honey, which is called defiled by characteristics.

source_sentence: 若比丘食上，大得甘蔗，食殘笮作漿得夜分受。
translation: If a monk eats it, he'll get a big hunk of sugarcane and make syrup from the leftover boards, which he'll be able to eat at night.

source_sentence: 若飲不盡，得煎作石蜜七日受。
translation: If he doesn't finish it, he can boil it and make rock honey for seven days and accept it.

source_sentence: 石蜜不盡，燒作灰終身受。
translation: If he doesn't finish the rock honey, he'll burn it ashes and accept it for the rest of his life.

source_sentence: 若有事不得壓，即中前應以水作淨，當作是言：「此中有淨物生，我當受。」
translation: If there's something he can't crush, then he should use water to purify it before he goes in, saying, "Something pure has arisen here, and I will accept it."

source_sentence: 若食上多得果，食不盡，得笮作漿夜分受。
translation: If he eats much of the fruit of that food and doesn't finish it, he can make a paste on a board and eat it every night.

source_sentence: 若有事不得笮，即時應當作是言：「此中淨物生，我當受。」
translation: If there's something you can't board up, then you should immediately say, "Something pure has arisen here, and I will accept it."

source_sentence: 若時過不應作。
translation: If the time is too short, you shouldn't do it.

source_sentence: 然燈者，若篤信女人施眾僧食，并作餅盛然燈施僧，僧不應合明受，當使淨人取。
translation: Suppose a faithful woman gives food to the saṃgha and makes a cake filled with lanterns to give to the saṃgha, but the saṃgha shouldn't accept it together with the knowledge that it will be taken by a clean person.

source_sentence: 若無淨人者，當語使放地，滅燈已然後受。
translation: If there's no one pure, you must tell them to put it on the ground and accept it after extinguishing the lamp.

source_sentence: 若女人信心故不欲滅，慇懃故得受。
translation: If a woman has faith and doesn't want to extinguish it, she'll accept it because of her kindness.

source_sentence: 受已持刀去膩，然後得食，是名然燈。
translation: After accepting it, she removes the grease with a knife and then gets to eat it, which is called giving the lamp a proper rest.

source_sentence: 酪瓶者，食時得多酪，食不盡，得即煎作生酥七日受。
translation: A cheese-vessel eater gets a lot of cheese when they eat it, and if they don't finish it, they can immediately boil it and make it into raw butter for seven days.

source_sentence: 若生酥長，得煎作熟酥七日受。
translation: If the raw butter is long, he can decoct it into cooked butter and accept it for seven days.

source_sentence: 若比丘乞食時多得酥，若是少知識比丘，即以細緻[疊*毛]淨漉取酥，得七日受。
translation: If a monk begging for food gets a lot of butter, or if he's a monk with little knowledge, he can take butter and purify it with a fine [tuft of *hair] and get seven days' worth of acceptance.

source_sentence: 若有事緣不得中前作，當作是言：「此中淨物生，我當作七日藥受。」
translation: If there's some reason he can't do it before, he should say, "This is a pure thing that arises, and I'll take it as medicine for seven days."

source_sentence: 若誤忘不受，不作淨時過，是名不淨。
translation: If he mistakenly forgets not to accept it and doesn't make a mistake in purifying it, this is called impure.

source_sentence: 若乞食時得多油，如上酥中說。
translation: If he gets a lot of oil when he's begging for food, it's as explained in the above-mentioned ghee.

source_sentence: 若食上得多胡麻，食殘不盡得，即笮作油七日受。
translation: If he gets a lot of caraway on a meal and doesn't eat all of it, he'll make oil on a board and accept it for seven days.

source_sentence: 若事緣不得作，如上酥中說，是名酪瓶。
translation: If it's not possible to make it for any reason, as explained in the above-mentioned ghee, this is called a vial of butter.

source_sentence: 脂者，僧中行魚脂、熊脂、羆脂、猪脂、失修摩羅脂，少知識比丘得持細緻[疊*毛]漉取，得七日受。
translation: That fat is fish fat, bear fat, bear fat, pig fat, or fat from the loss of kumāra that's practiced in the saṃgha, and a monk with a little knowledge can take a fine [heap*hair] of it and filter it, which gives him seven days of sensation.

source_sentence: 若事緣不得作，如上酥中說。
translation: If it's for any reason that it can't be done, it's as explained in the above-mentioned ghee.

source_sentence: 若眾僧中分油時，或欲持作淨油、或作七日油、或作然燈油、或作塗足油、或作塗身油，若分不足還斂著一處者，一切不淨。
translation: When oil is distributed among the saṃgha, whether it's intended to be held for pure oil, oil for seven days, oil for a lamp, oil for coating the feet, or oil for coating the body, if it's not enough to be distributed and is still held in one place, all will be impure.

source_sentence: 若淨油還著淨油，一處洗盛令淨與淨人。
translation: If pure oil is added to pure oil, one place is washed and made clean, and the person is purified.

source_sentence: 如是七日油還著七日油，一處洗盛令淨與淨人。
translation: Thus, when seven days of oil are added to seven days of oil, one place is washed and made clean, and the person is purified.

source_sentence: 如是然燈油、塗足油，得已應受。
translation: Thus, he should accept the oil for lighting lamps and the oil for coating his feet after he obtains it.

source_sentence: 若比丘欲服灰飲油者，灰是終身藥，油是七日藥，不得先服灰、後服油；當先服油，洗手澡口令淨已，然後服灰。
translation: If a monk wants to take ashes and drink oil, ashes are a lifelong medicine, and oil is a seven-day medicine; he must first take the oil, wash his hands and mouth to purify them, and then take the ashes.

source_sentence: 若比丘下分有病者，應先服酥。
translation: If a monk's lower parts are sick, he should first take ashes.

source_sentence: 酥者七日藥，澡手洗口令淨，然後乃食。
translation: This is seven days of medicine, so he should wash his hands and mouth to make them clean before eating it.

source_sentence: 若比丘上分有病者，欲令食上服酥者，酥是七日藥，食竟洗口澡手令淨，然後服酥。
translation: If a monk in the upper portion of the monastery is sick and wants to make the monastery eat ghee, ghee is seven days of medicine; after eating it, he washes his mouth and hands to make them clean, and then he takes ghee.

source_sentence: 若比丘服油訖，有殘油欲作然燈油、若塗足油，和上、阿闍梨來，見已嫌多，若更飲者，得越比尼罪。
translation: If a monk who has finished taking oil and has leftover oil that he wants to make into oil for a lamp or oil for coating his feet, and he meets with a superior or a priest who sees that it's too much, then he'll be guilty of transgressing the vinaya if he drinks more.

source_sentence: 若比丘食石蜜，欲飲夜分漿者，當先洗口令淨然後飲漿。
translation: If a monk who has eaten rock honey wants to drink the nighttime portion of the drink, he must first wash his mouth to make it clean and then drink the drink.

source_sentence: 若飲漿已欲食石蜜，亦如是。
translation: If he wants to eat rock honey after drinking the milk, he likewise will do so.

source_sentence: 若比丘欲煮石蜜，當使淨人煮。
translation: If a monk wants to boil rock honey, he'll have a clean person do it.

source_sentence: 若比丘自受酥，如酥觸酥、酥觸油、酥觸蜜、酥觸石蜜、酥觸生酥、酥觸脂，如是油、蜜、石蜜、生酥，乃至脂觸酥、脂觸油、脂觸蜜、脂觸生酥、脂觸石蜜、脂觸脂，亦復如是。
translation: If a monk receives butter himself, it's likewise when butter touches butter, butter touches oil, butter touches honey, butter touches rock honey, butter touches raw butter, butter touches fat, such as oil, honey, rock honey, and raw butter, or even when butter touches fat, fat touches oil, fat touches honey, fat touches raw butter, fat touches rock honey, and fat touches fat.

source_sentence: 時食、夜分、七日、終身共雜者，得時服。
translation: Those who eat at the same time, share the same mixture of nighttime, seven days, and whole life will be able to take it at the right time.

source_sentence: 夜分、七日、終身共雜者，得夜分服。
translation: When the nighttime portion, seven days, and whole life are combined, it's possible to take the nighttime portion.

source_sentence: 七日、終身共合者，得七日服。
translation: If seven days and his whole body are combined, he'll be given a seven-day robe.

source_sentence: 若少知識比丘，乞食時得赤鹽紫鹽等，應淨洗鹽終身受。
translation: If a monk with few friends gets red salt or purple salt when he begs for food, he should purify the salt and accept it for his whole life.

source_sentence: 若得胡椒蓽鉢，亦復如是。
translation: If he gets a pepper pickle bowl, he'll do likewise.

source_sentence: 若少知識比丘，乞食時得黑石蜜、得白石蜜，淨洗除食氣，作七日藥受，是故說。
translation: If a monk with few friends obtains black rock honey or white rock honey while soliciting alms, he purifies it to remove his food odor and makes it available for seven days as medicine, which is why it's said.

source_sentence: 摩訶僧祇律卷第十
translation: (*Mahāsāṃghika-vinaya, vol. 10)
